website_summaries.verdict: Simple one-ingredient treat (just fish or meat) will make you feel good about treating your cat.
pros: Treats are available in 4 different sized bags
Each protein-rich chicken bite has only 3 calories
Bottom of the container is often filled with leftover crumbs that can be sprinkled on top of your cat’s food
cons: Treats crumble easily, which may or may not be a good thing

customer_reviews.title: Watch out for skin!
customer_reviews.text: I love this brand and have purchased a variety of their flavors for my cat’s breakfast (she is picky and won’t eat the same thing more than three days in a row). The price point is good, I can pronounce all the ingredients, but some of the pieces still have the skin on and it’s very hard for her to chew. She’ll try, but usually ends up hacking it up in my shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Burton

customer_reviews.title: Lots of crumbs
customer_reviews.text: My kitty LOVES these treats. Me...not so much. The good is that it is just chicken with no preservatives. Unfortunately, the package is just a little over an ounce and more then 25% of package is small crumbs. Not usable for treats. When I contacted the company their response was, “That’s just the way it is.” They suggested I add it to my kitty’s food. It’s a lot of money for crumbs.
customer_reviews.author: RVartist

customer_reviews.title: Great Treats
customer_reviews.text: I have been trying to buy better foods for my cats. I tried these as they were just meat, freeze dried. The cats love them and they were pretty inexpensive for the quality. They smell though. Like a lot. Like someone microwaved fish in the office microwave (Thanks Josh). If you can handle smelly treats for the few seconds they'll be on the floor they're a great deal.
customer_reviews.author: Morkeleb

customer_reviews.title: Cat Loves
customer_reviews.text: Pros: (only things I was looking for) - Cat loves - Pure Meat/Healthier option - Avoids certain allergies - Bag conceals smell - Don't look like fish Cons: (to humans, cats not as much) - Chunks are a bit big (benefit to my cat, but not for me) - Smell like fish - Cat enjoys a bit too much... ((He loves them much he turns into the predator he thinks he is... so not the best for training as after about 2 he tries to obtain them through violence))
customer_reviews.author: Jenn and Ed

customer_reviews.title: Good value, cats love it, but some cat parent quality control involved
customer_reviews.text: My cats really enjoy this as a treat. The only negative is that some pieces, particularly the ones with skin attached, are sometimes too big or too hard for them. I find myself discarding overly hard pieces with skin attached that if our girls were interested in, they might choke on. They have the consistency of wood chips. The larger pieces that are a good consistency I just break up for them but it's slightly annoying. My cats love this variety and this brand in general, but I don't love the quality control that goes into feeding it to them.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: My kitty loves them!
customer_reviews.text: I have these on subscribe and save for my cat with kidney issues. She is on a special vet diet for life (y/d). Although science diet does not recommend anything but their diet for the rest of the cat's life,I feel bad only feeding her the same thing for the rest of her life. I did some research and plain chicken is low in iodine. This treat is made of plain freeze dried chicken and my kitty loves them!! I give her a few a day (3 or 4) and feel they increase her quality of life. She is maintaining weight and labs are good. So, even though science diet does not recommend them, they have worked well for us!
customer_reviews.author: Honest and Helpful

customer_reviews.title: My cat goes wild over them
customer_reviews.text: My cat will come running when she sees the bag. I dare not refuse her one. Tangling with a full size tiger might be safer! Will not conduct the experiment.
customer_reviews.author: tprin

customer_reviews.title: My Cat Loves These!!
customer_reviews.text: Finally a treat that my cat really loves. She is not big on treats but if she find the bag of these she will rip open the bag and eat the entire bag (which she has done with no side effects). I order these constantly they are expensive but don't get thrown away like so many others. If I order enough at once Amazon secures them in the plastic airbags so that don't get smashed as they do crumble easy and if they just throw them in with other things they are powder when they reach me. Thank you Amazon for beginning to go the extra mile in packing fragile things carefully.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Kitty vomited after eating these Bites.
customer_reviews.text: I have ordered these as least once time before and kitty loved them. I thought it would be a good source of protein for him. This most recent order, however, seems to have a problem. Both times kitty has snacked on these Bites, he has vomited. I don't have the original bag for the bites that have made him ill, but I do have another bag that I ordered at the same time. The numbers on the back (not UPC code) are 097611, BB/MA : DEC 2020.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria King

customer_reviews.title: Picky kitties crazy for these!
customer_reviews.text: We have two new kittens. Super food motivated...except when it comes to treats. We've now tried several different brands - all ones our dearly departed kitties loved - and their reactions are all over the place. One of them likes one type, and the other doesn't, or they'll love one type one day but are "Meh" about it the next. Both turned up their noses at the old kitties' favorite. But these? They go totally bonkers for them. Which is kinda too bad, because they're spendy, but what the heck - they're worth it!
customer_reviews.author: B. Hill

customer_reviews.title: My dog goes crazy for these!
customer_reviews.text: I have an Eskie with a sensitive stomach (and possibly allergies) who's on a strict diet. His protein is whitefish so these are one of the very few treats he can have. He absolutely loves them! He goes crazy for them!! The first time I bought them I got the cat ones by accident... the only difference is the size; the dog ones are much larger pieces. I actually keep a bag of each in the house all the time now and use the smaller (cat) ones for some things (like training) and the larger (dog) ones for treats or if I need to trade him for something he shouldn't have. I've purchased quite a few bags and always pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Debi

customer_reviews.title: I'm rating this on behalf of a fat cat
customer_reviews.text: My cat LOVES these things. He's really picky about food and treats, but these are winners! He can't get enough of the shrimp, chicken, and salmon, though the tiny shrimps are his favorite, by far. We keep these in little glass jars because he steals the bag to chew through them. These STINK! (But in a good, low tide way, my cat assures me.) He comes at me like a shark when they're out. The people in the house like that they are full protein, wholesome snacks for our little cat-shark.
customer_reviews.author: lia

customer_reviews.title: My Cat Went Crazy for These!  OMG!
customer_reviews.text: Bought two packages of the chicken and two packages of the turkey. Took them out of the Amazon box, opened the package and my cat came running out of the other room and started going bananas! My cat tried to snatch them from my hand while clenched tight. Gave my cat these treats and he spent a couple minutes licking up every little tiny piece that accidentally dropped from his mouth. Then he hung out and and kept circling and meowing for more. What a great treat! Will definitely buy more of these for him. A+++
customer_reviews.author: IWASME

customer_reviews.title: Good but pricey
customer_reviews.text: My cat LOVES this treat. But, you get a lot of tiny pieces and a bunch of chicken “dust” in the bag. Unless your cat has bad teeth, it’s a much better value to purchase the Purebites for dogs. The price per ounce was 1/3 the cost when I last purchased. Yes, the pieces are bigger. But, most of them can be easily broken apart. As I also have a dog, it’s convenient to buy the same treat for both pets. The dog gets the big pieces and the cat gets the smaller ones. Everyone’s happy & I’ve saved a little money.
customer_reviews.author: NinaTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: something has changed
customer_reviews.text: I used to order purebites and buy these in the store too, but recently the purebites has looked darker yellow and more crunchy appearance, so not sure what has happened but my cats seem less interested in these than what was sold before. I may have to resort to buying the one for dogs even though it may be bigger and less costly based on weight but hopefully it won't look so yellow/crunchy for the last 2 orders I have received
customer_reviews.author: Mom of Two

customer_reviews.title: My Cat, Tess, Loves These Treats!
customer_reviews.text: Our cat is 19 years old but she has remained active and still has a very healthy appetite. We have never gotten into the habit of giving her treats but noticed she was very interested when the dogs got their "cookies". I researched to find something healthy for her and the Chicken Purebites seemed to fit the bill perfectly. The minute the bag was opened and she smelled the treats she was hooked. She seems to love the flavor. These are practically weightless but the bag is full and there are more treats than you might think at first. Very happy with this addition to my Subscribe and Save items...(and so is Tess)
customer_reviews.author: Robin S.

customer_reviews.title: Ordered Pure Bites, not dust
customer_reviews.text: My cats love Pure Bites, not freeze dried tuna dust. These arrived in a padded envelope, so the 'bites' were pulverized. $3.49 wasted.
customer_reviews.author: Keri Dowling

customer_reviews.title: Kitties say two paws up
customer_reviews.text: My kitties love all of the Pure Bites dehydrated cat treats. I end up topping their canned food with a few of the treats to get them to eat because they change their mind from day to day about what canned food is acceptable to them. This way they always eat (at least half) of their meal. One warning about the tuna flavored treats...they are stinky! You'll smell like fish if you don't wash your hands well after touching them. But of course, the cats don't care if you smell that way.
customer_reviews.author: Austintacious

customer_reviews.title: Found a zip tie in the bag 🤮
customer_reviews.text: Today I found a used zip tie in this bag of treats. Naturally I am horrified at what else could be in these bags that I’m feeding to my kitties. Never buying again.
customer_reviews.author: Medina Maitreya

customer_reviews.title: Molly gives this Five Cats Paws Up!
customer_reviews.text: Well, we all know cats, and we know they are picky and... what can I say? Either yours will hate these or, like our one cat, refuse to eat any other treat ever made. Molly thinks they taste great (she's the one who rated the flavor as I was afraid to try one) and they stink to high heavens (so much so that you had better pour them out and not put them in your hand or it will NEVER stop smelling). But Molly's in love and they are cheap and easy to order so when your cat is happy, you're happy.
customer_reviews.author: Michael D. Kelley

customer_reviews.title: Most of the Bag Ended Up Wasted
customer_reviews.text: They stopped including the dehydration pouch a while back which caused the most of the food ending up soggy and hard. Only a few pieces are crunchy and the rest is really hard to chew for my cats like a piece of cardboard. I've getting these bags over a long period of time but no more. Ended up more than 50 bags with a bulk of it still left in the bag. Probably feed to wild animals. I found a better alternative which is more breakable, crunch. Bye bye purebites. YOu need to do something about not letting the chicken get too hard.
customer_reviews.author: Sophie

customer_reviews.title: Finicky cat approved!
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased many dehydrated chicken pieces for cats over the years. Previous brands have come in too large of a piece and I would have to break them, resulting in tiny pieces and dust going all over the counter. Sometimes they would be dried so much a cat couldn’t eat them. I was happy to see that these are indeed little bite size. Even though they are more like hard food, my cat can easily chew and digest them. Two paws up!
customer_reviews.author: S. Harmon

customer_reviews.title: Super
customer_reviews.text: My very finicky cats love these. Out of all the Purebites varieties I tried, they liked these the most. Even the dog liked them, so he got his own Whitefish for dogs. I am very careful about treats, due to all the horror events in the last 15 years or so with treats that killed pets. These are exactly what I am looking for in a treat for my furry ones, healthy, clean, no chemicals.
customer_reviews.author: Doina "Day" Berndt dba Kalyana Design

customer_reviews.title: My animals love these, but they fall apart
customer_reviews.text: All of my animals go crazy for these snacks. Dogs, cats. Doesn't matter. They all love it. I'd buy these forever, but they fall apart and at least half of the bag is just shreds that are hard to grab. I have to give each animal a little pile of crumbs. They don't complain, but it's a PITA for me. If you have a pet that isn't a great eater, try these. All my animals adore them.
customer_reviews.author: Cindi Clinton

customer_reviews.title: My Cat loves them.  Me, no so much
customer_reviews.text: These are freeze dried beef liver. It is real beef liver. Do not get them wet, it will rehydrate. This is the favorite. Both cats like them almost as much as pounces. These are way more natural than pounces. The fish ones can be stinky and gross, although my cat likes them too. The beef and Duck liver are their favorites for sure.
customer_reviews.author: M. J. Sears

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: These look like wood chips and must taste like them because my cat wanted nothing to do with them. Even my neighbor's cat that eats anything wouldn't touch them.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Peterson

customer_reviews.title: Not the best flavor
customer_reviews.text: I almost exclusively buy PureBites for our cats, and this flavor makes one of them throw up every single time.
customer_reviews.author: rachface

customer_reviews.title: Cat finds these ok but not favorite....
customer_reviews.text: My cat likes these but not as much as some of the other flavors. They seem to be good quality. They come in an over-sized plastic ziplock bag that can't be recycled and there is only a few tablespoons of product in the bag so it seems a wasteful amount of packaging. I will be looking for a brand with some sort of zero waste packaging solution, preferably something compostable or at least recyclable.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Rice

customer_reviews.title: Cat Goes CRAZY for These
customer_reviews.text: I have two cats one of which who was never super food motivated like our other chonky boi. I got these treats and the unmotivated by food cat literally goes nuts for these treats. Whenever we open the drawer we put the treats in he runs over and gets all excited, he will literally tear the treat bag to shreds if he gets the chance. The other cat likes them too! I feel good feeding them these are they are just chicken and they love them so much that they are worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: Autumn B.

customer_reviews.title: My cat LOVES these treats.
customer_reviews.text: My cat loses her mind when I open the bag. She immediately starts yowling. She loves them. If your cat is a fan of fish, get these for him/her. They're great, because they're simple and healthy. The only warning I have is that they smell awful. It's to be expected, since they're dried fish, but I figured I'd still put a warning out there. These treats smell overwhelmingly fishy. I find myself washing my hands every time I touch these things. Other than that, they're perfect!
customer_reviews.author: frawgster

customer_reviews.title: Arrived largely in powdered form or tiny flakes.
customer_reviews.text: My cats really like the flavor, and of course this is healthy for them. But at least half of the contents of the package, if not more, arrived in powder form or tiny flakes. The other half was in chunks that are too large for a cat. Not at all as the product photo shows. Difficult and messy to try to treat or train the cats using POWDERED chicken breast! Will not order this brand again.
customer_reviews.author: KJK

customer_reviews.title: My cats LOVED these!
customer_reviews.text: My cats LOVED these. I bought primarily for my cat who is diabetic and seemed to be STARVING mid-day so I wanted to give him a small snack that would satisfy him for a minute. Yes, I got it approved with his veterinarian first!! I love that it has NO other ingredients. The only critique I have is that the pieces are either large and I have to break them or too small, so they are kind of messy. I would buy again though as it is a healthier alternative to other treats.
customer_reviews.author: Billi Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Many cats agree.... cardboard is better!
customer_reviews.text: So, I didn't try these, but my cats LOVE the whitefish, chicken and turkey version of the PureBits. Tried the liver, because... why not!? My three didn't love them... one would put it in his mouth, then spit them out, the others just turned up their nose. Gave these to a family friend who has 5 "non-picky" cats... none would eat these, but she ended up given them to the dogs... who are fat and "don't need treats.." just a warning..
customer_reviews.author: Richard in Texas

customer_reviews.title: Cat couldn’t care any less for PureBites. My dog liked them, though.
customer_reviews.text: My cat didn’t care for this at all. My dog, on the other hand, loved it (but he eats everything). The reason for the low rating is I wanted to focus on building my relationship with the cat by using enticing treats. It’s unfortunate that the product didn’t really live up to what it advertised. My cat just stared at it. A couple of times he went over to it and sniffed it, but that was all. If I added other treats like Greenies, for some reason he would eat the Greenies AND the PureBites treat. I was hoping PureBites would work by its own scent, though.
customer_reviews.author: Meep

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING!!!
customer_reviews.text: I feed all my pets purebites treats because they are the only treats with 1 ingredient. This is the safest and healthiest option for literally every animal!! (Just research what meats are safe for the specific pet to be eating!)
customer_reviews.author: Linda D.

customer_reviews.title: My cat likes them, but ...
customer_reviews.text: My cat likes these a lot, but I don't like that all of the pieces are different sizes. Some are too big for him, so I have to break them into smaller pieces, but because they are freeze-dried they tend to crumble and make a mess. Still, Rupurrt does enjoy them. I wish all of the pieces could be a consistent size, but I suppose it's just the nature of freeze-dried fish.
customer_reviews.author: R. Spivey

customer_reviews.title: Requires work for cat to eat
customer_reviews.text: I ordered several different flavors, which all had the same problem: not cut uniformily, some pieces being the size of a sardine & too hard to break apart. I had to grind with a milling blade so cat could eat them.
customer_reviews.author: T. Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Both my cats love the treats, but beware of huge chunks and lots of powder.
customer_reviews.text: Due to a medical condition one of my cats can only have single ingredient treats and his diet. Fortunately both my cats love this product. I give these to my kitties every day, and they cannot get enough. My only criticism is that the treats are very uneven in size. Some pieces are so big I have to break them in as much as 6 pieces in order to be bite sized, meanwhile a lot of the product is power at the bottom of the bag, which can only be served on to of my cats’ food.
customer_reviews.author: Laura D.

customer_reviews.title: Not tasty to my cat
customer_reviews.text: Cat ate the first one, hesitated with the second one, flat out NO on the third one. He pushed it off the table. Apparently not tasty to him, though other freeze-dried treats go over extremely well. I gave these to my sibling's cat who seemed really confused, also didn't go for them. These kind of look like little bricks. I was hoping these would work as I like the Purebites brand for being simply meat! But this one was a miss unfortunately.
customer_reviews.author: Zoomo

customer_reviews.title: Good product, too much packaging
customer_reviews.text: My cat enjoys these and they seem good quality. They come in an over-sized plastic ziplock bag that can't be recycled and there is only a few tablespoons of product in the bag so it seems a wasteful amount of packaging. I will be looking for a brand with some sort of zero waste packaging solution, preferably something compostable or at least recyclable.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Rice

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Diabetic Cats!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these for my mom who has a diabetic cat. It’s hard finding treats which don’t mess with his glucose and it’s equally hard for my mom to corner him to prick his ear to monitor his glucose. He loves these so much he’ll just run when he hears the bag and he sits still while he gets a treat and a small job. Happy kitty, happy mama, happy me. Definitely recommend - especially for senior cats or those with sensitive stomached. They smell very fishy and are all natural - my 14 year old cat loves them too and she hates everything.
customer_reviews.author: Miss U

customer_reviews.title: Wow a company that actually cares about my Kitto!
customer_reviews.text: My picky brat cat loves these and they don’t stink!(cat eats gross me out) they’re def not cheap but I feel a lot better about giving my cat this treat as it is clearly what it says it is-freeze dried chicken. Honestly, I would have no problem/shame eating one. My cat hates all healthy food and treats. She’s of the Mcdonalds trash bag palette variety, but finally a win! She did have a minor chokey moment on one in the beginning, probably because she is inhaling its deliciousness, so now I break them up a little. Great product thanks for actually caring about our loved ones!
customer_reviews.author: Kaleigh

customer_reviews.title: Great Treats but Arrives like Sawdust
customer_reviews.text: I think these are good quality treats and my cat likes them, however they arrive completely crushed. There are only a few substantial pieces in the pack and the rest is basically a sawdust like texture which I don't want to feed to my cat. Perhaps a new packaging needs to be considered.
customer_reviews.author: Alex S

customer_reviews.title: Worth trying, but not all cats will eat them
customer_reviews.text: In an endeavor to feed our cats a higher quality healthy treat, we gave PurBites a try. We have 12 cats - 3 are outdoor cats. One out of the 12 cats ate one piece and walked away from a second attempt. All of the other cats sniffed them and walked away. I don't doubt that these are high quality, but our cats won't eat them. Maybe they've been eating Friskies treats too long. We bought one bag of chicken, one turkey, and one Shrimp. Now two of the cats liked the shrimp ok, but not the other flavors.
customer_reviews.author: Praise Band Brian

customer_reviews.title: My cats ADORE these treats!
customer_reviews.text: My cats ADORE these. They are obsessed with them to almost a scary extent. I've gotten them the tuna, salmon and chicken so far and they love, LOVE every single flavor. Despite the tuna smelling a bit like goldfish food, they aren't too bad as far as smell goes. It's good to know and see exactly what you're giving your cats. There's no denying that this is real fish and chicken. I highly recommend these!
customer_reviews.author: cm culinarian

customer_reviews.title: It would be 5-star, but it comes crushed
customer_reviews.text: I've ordered this a few times and my pet LOVES it. However, be prepared, as Amazon keeps sending it in an envelope instead of a box, so all of the freeze-dried treats are practically DUST by the time you get them in the mail. Granted, they sent me a replacement, but it was AGAIN in an envelope, so it was mostly crushed again. Product is great, shipping method isnt.
customer_reviews.author: DubstepWarren

customer_reviews.title: cat loves them
customer_reviews.text: I have a really strange and picky cat. She's the only one I've ever had that didn't like fish. However she loves chicken.She has a dry kibble every day, and I give her can shredded chicken cat food a couple times a week. But if she had her way she'd eat dried chicken all the time and not just as an evening treat. While she will tolerate being given dried turkey she definitely prefers the chicken.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bag of dust.
customer_reviews.text: My cats do love this product and each item in this product line. However, purchasing and receiving a bag that is half bag squeez'ens and dust does not make this product a cost effective purchase and returning a product that is less then four dollars a bag is a complete waste of time. This is much to common in this product line. Buy at your own risk.
customer_reviews.author: mousehound369

customer_reviews.title: AVOID!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This purchase ruined my weekend! I bought these treats because I had recently been reading about how great liver is for us and our pets alike. I opened these on Saturday and gave 2 small pieces to my cat. About 3 minutes later my cat throws up. She proceeds to throw up non-stop for the next hour and a half. I rushed her to the vet and they were able to give her some anti-nausea medicine. I felt horrible for my poor kitty and regret this purchase that resulted in a horrible weekend for us both and a $150 dollar vet bill.
customer_reviews.author: Anna Maimone

customer_reviews.title: Cats were not impressed!
customer_reviews.text: Both of my cats hated this product, which was very surprising! I'm trying to wean them off eating canned tuna, and this didn't come close to winning them over. Both kind of sniffed the bites and walked away; I've been unable to win them over for the last week; normally, my cats will eat any kind of treat put in front of them. The actual pieces seem too large for cats (I don't want to spend my time breaking them up!) - so it's possible that that's part of the problem. I wish I could return the open package, but at least they weren't too expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Meg

customer_reviews.title: Switching Brands
customer_reviews.text: I bought these treats because I had bought the sampler from this company and my cats went nuts for the chicken. This bag was disappointing, it was almost 90% dust and a few fluffy pieces and rock hard nuggets that even my cats wouldnt touch. I put the dust over their food and they loved it but, it totally defeated the point of giving treats. I switched to another brand and not only is it cheaper but it was virtually no dust and not a single hard piece. I wont be buying these again, I gave it three stars only because even if it was a pouch full of dust my cats still enjoyed it.
customer_reviews.author: Karen CTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Cats LOVE them and sometimes skirmish ensues
customer_reviews.text: Cats really love these treats, so much so, they refuse to eat their other treats until I give them more of the chicken ones. No joke. I just wish the price was really better and it was available at local grocery stores instead of just the pet store since there are none close to me.
customer_reviews.author: Celeste Costello

customer_reviews.title: My cats like it
customer_reviews.text: My cats like this stuff. It’s a little weird, kinda feels like packaging peanuts or something, but they like it. The pieces are small but not uniform in size or shape, and there Is a good deal of powdered treat piled at the bottom of the bag; which is a plus in my case. One of my cats eats like some kind of pig-god and the less readily gulped powder slows her frenzied feeding long enough for my older cat to enjoy his space-chicken—that’s what it is, have you ever had dehydrated ice cream like astronauts eat? It’s like that but chicken. Again, my cats like it.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Great for a diabetic cat
customer_reviews.text: I have two diabetic cats who are both very old now. One of them just got fussy about her food and I chose PureBites to give her a pure food to eat and help with her diabetes. These have been a great, healthy snack for the both of them. Both cats love them. Almost all dry cat foods, even the grain free, are filled with some type of sugar (corn/peas) or starch (potatoes/tapioca) so I am thrilled to have these PureBites chicken treats to help keep my diabetic cats healthy.
customer_reviews.author: TM

customer_reviews.title: Great product, don't let the weight scare you off. It's a treat not dinner and the volume of product is reasonable for the price
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic product in my no so humble opinion. None of the binders and fillers of other cat treats, no foreign sourced meats or odd components that destroy your animals kidneys like melamine (see Chinese made treat controversies) and such. Our cat isn't terribly fond of treats in general and she gobbles these up and rubs your legs hoping for more. They also don't have any of that nasty, greasy feeling in hand that sends you running to wash up after giving kitty some treats. Odor is also fairly inert, it appears to be chicken breast that was maybe cooked, diced and then freeze dried.
customer_reviews.author: J. Reedy

customer_reviews.title: I give up!
customer_reviews.text: My cat loves these, but the last few packages I've ordered have been crushed. There have been very few edible pieces to use as treats after brushing him or clipping his nails. I don't know if this happens during shipping, storage, or if they were packaged that way. But enough is enough, and I give up on this brand.
customer_reviews.author: mags

customer_reviews.title: Great product but very messy
customer_reviews.text: I REALLY appreciate the fact that somebody tried to make cat treats from only one ingredient. These arrived so crushed however that 1/4 of the bag was just dust. It made a big mess toward the end of the bag. Maybe if you buy this at the store it wouldn’t be so crushed? Thank you anyway and please try to perfect this product as the effort is very appreciated.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: My cat LOVES these
customer_reviews.text: On a whim, I ordered these tuna treats for my cat, who only likes fish-flavored food and treats. I had been ordering the freeze dried shrimp, which he loves, but a lot of the shrimp was just shrimp dust. I felt like I was paying for a few real pieces of shrimp and a lot of shrimp dust. Well, much to my surprise, he loved these tuna treats, and I feel like I get a much better deal for my money. The treats seem to stay more intact than the shrimp; the package is larger by weight, and my cat is very happy. You can't go wrong! Great treat for my Fergus.
customer_reviews.author: diannef

customer_reviews.title: It's going to arrive crushed into powder if you get it as subscribe and save
customer_reviews.text: My cats love it. However, if you do it as a subscribe and save, it will arrive crushed into a powder. Do you like expensive dehydrated fish powder to sprinkle on your catfood? Because that's how it will arrive. 3 months in a row the arrived under heavy items in a box packed poorly.
customer_reviews.author: Sam C

customer_reviews.title: Can't argue with a Cat!
customer_reviews.text: My Feline Best Friend read the label, took a sniff of the "Healthier" contents, and would NOT even taste it, unless I laboriously chopped the bits into granules and put them in her wet foods. At times, she would not even eat that combination. I guess I'm too far over the return period. Another "Best of Intentions" experience.
customer_reviews.author: D. G. Evans

customer_reviews.title: One cat loves it!
customer_reviews.text: We have 4 cats. One is so-so with these cod treats. Two of them like them, but the third absolutely demands them. I don't know what we will do if we run out of these treats. I have ordered these twice from Amazon. Unfortunately, in the last order these came "squished" with lots of fish powder rather than pieces. Apparently, somewhere along the way the handling was rather poor.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Shkabara

customer_reviews.title: Picky Kitty Loves Them
customer_reviews.text: I have an incredibly picky cat who refuses to take any kind of treat that isn't freeze dried chicken. I have found it immensely hard to find affordable cat treats that she likes, as many of them do not offer very much and get very pricey. These cat treats are loved by my picky kitty! She gets very excited when she hears the bag open and actually eats them without a problem. These are Fantastic!
customer_reviews.author: Nikki

customer_reviews.title: They're 100% chicken breast and they're not raw
customer_reviews.text: This is a unique type of cat treats, being it's 100% freeze dried chicken. I saw another reviewer say that it's raw. Well, if that's true, so is beef jerky, right? Anyhow, my cat Lucy really loves it. I like that there are no additives or preservatives... or for that matter, any other ingredients. I don't give get too many though,even though she'll beg lol. Because they're dehydrated, I don't want too much of these to deplete her body of fluid.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen S

customer_reviews.title: My cat loves this product!
customer_reviews.text: My cat loves these things. She gets excited when she sees me shake the package. She’s a black cat, and black cats are beautiful and very intelligent! If she likes them, they must be good! They don’t have an oder either, so you will approve of them too. Order this product for your cat and she will love your even more!
customer_reviews.author: H. Carole Wheeler

customer_reviews.title: They feel and chip apart like balsa wood.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these per positive reviews in the ferret group in in. I went ahead and bought 2 bags as I dont have picky eatters. Well I gave each one of them 1. They all 4 looked at me then this thing in front of them and all walked off. So I soaked them in water, still out of the 4 only 1 likes them and he will eat just about anything. I wont be purchasing it again.
customer_reviews.author: Leah Kirschner

customer_reviews.title: Great for cats with sensitivities!
customer_reviews.text: One of our two cats is allergic to chicken, and it is nearly impossible to find chicken-free treats that aren’t wet. We even made our own for a while, until we found these. They do have a pretty strong odor, but only when the bag is open. The cats love them!
customer_reviews.author: RainbowSalazar

customer_reviews.title: Training kitten treat
customer_reviews.text: I have a Persian kitten that needs grooming daily. He doesn’t “love” it, but loves this treat. I am using this to help me groom him. I place the bag in front of him if I’m having trouble. He starts to smell it and I’m able to get more grooming accomplished. I have this on auto ship it is just that good!
customer_reviews.author: Jeanine Olson Wallace

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the Discerning Kitty Palate
customer_reviews.text: This review is for PureBites Chicken Cat Treats. Both of my cats love these. They devour them as if they haven’t eaten in days. With chicken as the only ingredient, they seem to be a better choice for my cats than some of the more processed treats. Too many can cause an upset stomach for my 16 pound cat, so his intake has to be limited. My eight pound cat however, can eat these with no problem. She is a cat treat snob, and will not eat a lot of the crunchy types. Overall, these treats are perfect for even the pickiest of furry diners.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: A nice, healthy snack for kitties
customer_reviews.text: A nice, healthy snack for kitties! The only ingredient is chicken, which you can really taste when you inevitably pop some into your mouth out of curiosity. (Don't try this with the salmon. Not good.) My only caveat is the price and size. A tiny 1oz package is $3 - the same price as a pound of chicken breast at my grocery store. If I'm going to feed my cats human-grade food, I want it to be affordable enough and available in big enough quantities that I can make a meal of it myself during the zombie apocalypse.
customer_reviews.author: Theo

customer_reviews.title: Looks like wood chips
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for the cat that LOVES chicken, he would not touch it. The other cat (who never eats chicken) ate what I put on the floor. There's no odor at all, at least that I could detect. I used my nails to put smaller pieces on the serving mat, its so dry it literally looks like wood chips. I can't believe it was eaten at all. Grateful it won't got to waste.
customer_reviews.author: K

customer_reviews.title: I love this brand!
customer_reviews.text: My cats aren't crazy about this flavor, but I have them to my parents for their cats, and they love them! My cats' favorite is the chicken one, and I go through a bag a month because the only ingredient is chicken, so I don't feel guilty giving them to my babies all the time.
customer_reviews.author: kylie lewis

customer_reviews.title: Causes constipation
customer_reviews.text: Cats are notorious for not drinking enough water, especially the older they are. My cat loves these, but today I noticed he is very constipated, and finally I thought feeding him dehydrated food is not a good idea. So I will soak these in water before he gets the rest, and probably will not purchase these again for that reason.
customer_reviews.author: jgbeamish

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: Exceptional! Will continue to purchase ... Bought the salmon also... My cats can't get enough ... Will get the larger packages next time .... Update ... Reordered and will continue to order these ... My cats really love them... And none of them vomit like from other treats
customer_reviews.author: Terry Walker

customer_reviews.title: The kitties are crazy about these
customer_reviews.text: These were included in a Kit Nip box one month. My cats were crazy for them. So now I get a couple bags a month in addition to other treats. My one cat Guinness is hooked, if I gave him nothing but these treats he’d be thrilled.
customer_reviews.author: B. A. Gould

customer_reviews.title: My cat loves it...
customer_reviews.text: I’m sure my cat loves the smell, but I sure don’t. I’m not knocking the product though, because it IS ACTUAL FISH. lol. Can’t really disguise that smell. Cats can’t get enough though. I will say, I put them into a jar because my cats will eat the entire bag, plastic included. When in the jar, I noticed it basically fell apart into fish dust... I just sprinkle it over their food now.
customer_reviews.author: Brittney

customer_reviews.title: We love that these are only one ingredient and so simply ...
customer_reviews.text: We got these for our diabetic cat so we could still give him treats because he deserves treats. He LOVES them. Our other cat, who isn't diabetic, also goes crazy for them. When we reach the end of the bag and there are just crumbs left, they fight to lick the last crumbs off the floor. We love that these are only one ingredient and so simply made-not a lot of processed grain and sugar, which is what likely caused our cat's diabetes in the first place. Super happy with these!
customer_reviews.author: M. K. Clark

customer_reviews.title: cats favorite
customer_reviews.text: My cats LOVE these! We have the minnows too and as you can imagine they smell a bit when opened. The chicken ones don't do that. The only thing I don't like about them is that there doesnt seem to be consistency. Some bags have a LOT of small crumbles and what could be called dust in the bag, others have normal chunks. I just sprinkle it on their wet food in the morning but this is what brings the rating down some.
customer_reviews.author: ChinchillaMeg

customer_reviews.title: This poisoned my cat
customer_reviews.text: I gave my cat these treats and I even rehydrates them a bit beforehand and he has been sick and lethargic since and it’s a struggle to get him to eat anything. He is also having stomach problems. My other cat wouldn’t even eat them. I’m pretty sure these are not a good thing to be feeding to your animal and if there is even a chance of this making your animal sick and not want to EAT that’s awful. Please don’t buy these. I’m about to contact amazon now for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Jeyreymew

customer_reviews.title: Crunchy
customer_reviews.text: My cat loves these to the point of addiction and they're almost calorie free so a potentially perfect treat; however, one-third to one-half are powder by the time they get here. I can sometimes use the powder by sprinkling on canned food but would prefer they all be crunchy treats.
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: A change for the worse.
customer_reviews.text: These chicken treats have changed. They no longer look and feel like pure chicken breasts. My cats will not eat many of the pieces anymore. At one time, they loved PureBites chicken breasts, but no more. Additionally, they arrive crushed in almost half the bag. I have changed to Whole Life, and will try them for a while. My cats loved Whole LIfe's first batch I recently purchased.
customer_reviews.author: 4felines

customer_reviews.title: Great treat and food topper for finicky kitties!
customer_reviews.text: My cats love these. I have a picky eater that turns her nose up at most food and I sprinkle this over her food and she gobbles it up. They are pretty fishy smelling but I think that is what is attractive to the kitties. They're easy to crumble when putting it over the food. They also like the chunks as a treat. Great price for them too. I recommend!
customer_reviews.author: artemis920

customer_reviews.title: DOORBUSTER!!!!!!😽
customer_reviews.text: My CAT LOVES these PURBITES!!! She switches from TURKEY to TUNA all the time.LOL I have no clue why,😽😻. NUGGET loves her PURRRRBITES!!!!!, everyone there PURRRRFECT, GREAT!!! For the 💰, Iam posting ever single one of my reviews, so the CUSTOMERS see what I wRITE!!!!
customer_reviews.author: MaryJane Hoad

customer_reviews.title: If the cats are happy, I'm happy.
customer_reviews.text: Hard to give a review without being the one consuming them, but they're always fresh and easily crumbled and the cats go bonkers for them. I get them via Subscribe and Save, lowering the price a bit makes a difference to me. Store them in a secure place. My chonker has done some acrobatics to get them and tear the bag open while I'm gone or sleeping.
customer_reviews.author: the real Kira Stoyko

customer_reviews.title: Crushed
customer_reviews.text: Wow this is the third and last time I order these treats..both bags have mostly crushed fish in them .. should have known better..
customer_reviews.author: kat

customer_reviews.title: Delicious for cats great for training
customer_reviews.text: My cat loves these and they’re perfect for training. If you don’t like the smell of fish, like really strong smell of fish then don’t buy it but that’s a given seeing as it’s literally pieces of fish. I hate fish but I wanna be a good cat mom so I endure it. There were some crumbled bits and the package was less full than I expected, but I think it’s great for the price bc you can always use the crumbled stuff on top of dry food. It arrived quickly and I’m definitely satisfied with my purchase
customer_reviews.author: McKenna

customer_reviews.title: Great value snack
customer_reviews.text: This product is insane for the price. My cats inhale these. They're really easy to grind into dust with my fingers to put on top of wet or dry food, which I must do for one of my cats (no teeth). It's nice to have a treat that all my cats will and can eat. I'll buy these again.
customer_reviews.author: Madisen

customer_reviews.title: Some love, some not, depends on your cat!
customer_reviews.text: My cat didn't like these but I bought them as a protein boost while he was getting chemo for cancer so I can't really trust his opinion. My other cat doesn't like treats at all so she didn't touch them either. Gave them to my neighbor who has a cat and he said that cat hoovered them up as quick as he put them down. Apparently, as with all food/treats, it depends on the cat! I bought them because of the high protein and the tiny ingredient list so if your cat will eat them it's a great choice.
customer_reviews.author: K.A.

customer_reviews.title: Kitty Tested and Approved - 2 enthusiastic paws up!
customer_reviews.text: My cat goes nuts for these. She would eat them as her meal if we let her. Since they are nothing but white meat chicken, we never hesitate to give her treats. Our vet even recommended them. I wish there were more chunks and less broken bits in the package but we've bought them through several retail sources and they all have it. HINT: They are far more economical to buy on Amazon than in a retail pet food store.
customer_reviews.author: GardenBugGal33

customer_reviews.title: Both my cats love this
customer_reviews.text: My picky eater gets a bit of this mixed in with his canned food. He doesn't like it as well in big chunks, rather, he prefers the crumbs. We refer to it as his seasoning. My other cat enjoys a larger piece now and then, but we try to limit his protein intake with his kidney issues.
customer_reviews.author: s. davis

customer_reviews.title: Official favorite treat for The Notorious H.A.M.
customer_reviews.text: My hamster goes nuts for this, even moreso than freeze dried meal worms. Very simple freeze dried chicken breast. That's it. I do recommend getting the larger pieces over the smaller ones. You'll need to break them up for small pets like hamsters, but the smaller pieces have a nasty habit of becoming chicken dust.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Good, lean protein for your kitties!
customer_reviews.text: My two cats love these chicken treats. One cat is a picky eater, and the other cat will eat almost anything, so it can be hard sometimes to find treats that they both like. These do the trick! They go crazy for them. I like that they are simply made out of freeze-dried chicken, no additives or questionable ingredients. They are therefore pure lean protein for cats, which is good for them instead of a lot of the treats out there that have added grains and fillers which just add weight onto your cat (and we know most cats are in need of losing weight, not gaining it!).
customer_reviews.author: KBrogan

customer_reviews.title: chicken came in tiny shreds/powder
customer_reviews.text: To begin with, the price is comparable with the same freeze-dried chicken from Petsmart. So it's not particularly competitive price-wise. The chicken arrived already crushed into powers. My cats still enjoyed it but they made a mess on the floor. I would buy from Petsmart next time.
customer_reviews.author: Y. Wu

customer_reviews.title: Kitty loves this!
customer_reviews.text: I can't' really review the flavor since I haven't eaten it...but...my cat LOVES this and goes crazy for it! She knows where I keep it and is often sitting on the floor under it meowing. It's her 'jackpot' treat and I have used this to coax her out of her comfort zone at times with this treat.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Cat loves them
customer_reviews.text: So my cat's allergic to everything but beef and it's super hard to find a treat for her that she can have, we are down to these and plain yogurt. Thank you for making these, she loves them and got into the drawer where we stored them, they are now being stored in a sealed cereal container at the top of the pantry because she likes them that much :)
customer_reviews.author: Mandi Kay

customer_reviews.title: Fussy Old Gal Loves It!
customer_reviews.text: Finding a healthy snack for a fussy old cat is a challenge. Much to my happiness, she loves this freeze dried tuna. This is the first time I've purchased a Purebites product, and I'm definitely buying the tuna again. Now to see if they have more freeze dried products. Thanks, PureBites!
customer_reviews.author: MsHarmonyTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Great Amazon Price- Great Item
customer_reviews.text: Great item because it has no ingredients... just freeze dried meat! One of my guys is a diabetic so he needs high protein and low carbs. Just meat is perfect. I have given my 3 guys many flavors and all are loved. I buy these for my mom's dog who also loves all the flavors. The treats are the same for both animals, but the cat treats are smaller. I can save money buy buying for a dog and breaking up the pieces. Either way- your dogs and cats will likely love these treats!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Happy Kitty
customer_reviews.text: Ok so our cat is a weirdo. She doesn't want to eat actual chicken or actual turkey, and she is all in all quite picky about treats. But when I open the treat cupboard she comes running for these things. The dog loves em too! Some pieces are a bit large for kitty, but they are easy to break. I've been getting these for her for a long time. Always happy.
customer_reviews.author: Rainfire

customer_reviews.title: Animals all
customer_reviews.text: My let’s all love every flavor we have gotten so far. Tuna, shrimp, chicken, turkey. They love love love them! I love giving them something with out all the crap in them. Definitely worth the extra money to give them the healthy stuff.
customer_reviews.author: kellie

customer_reviews.title: Bag full of crumbs! But my kitten loves the chunks that are in the bag.
customer_reviews.text: My kitten goes nuts over these treats! She saw the pkg and cried while I tried to open the bag. For that reason I love them. But I'm extremely disappointed in the fact that most of the bag had crumbs! There are very few chunks. I don't feel I'm getting my money's worth and may look for a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: Sue K.

customer_reviews.title: Fragile but tasty
customer_reviews.text: I bought a bag of these and a bag of the tuna treats for my 2 boys for Christmas. My older cat didn't care for them much but the youner cat LOVES them. There are a lot of shredded, crumbly bits, but he was a rescue cat and has a hard time eating really big pieces of solid food, so a little lickable pile of this stuff is perfect for him!
customer_reviews.author: MorbidMortician

product_meta.title: PureBites Hallmark Vida Spanish Graduation Card (Class of 2020)
product_meta.description: Size:1.09Oz | 31G - Value SizeGo ahead, turn the bag around and look at our ingredients. PureBites are made with only 1 ingredient; 100% Pure USA Sourced & Made Chicken Breast. Cats love the taste of PureBites because our treats are freeze dried RAW to lock in the aroma, texture and freshness they crave. Cat parents love PureBites because our treats are 100% pure and rich in nutrients for a happy and healthy life.
feature_bullets: Quality and performance driven products for your pet
Provide a better quality of living for your pet with Pure Bites

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Currently, item can be shipped only within the U.S. and to APO/FPO addresses. For APO/FPO shipments, please check with the manufacturer regarding warranty and support issues.
specifications.International Shipping: This item is not eligible for international shipping.
specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
